alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 16 at 11:05PM EST until January 16 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST FOR EAST CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY... At 1104 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Parole to Annapolis to near South River, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Annapolis, Mayo, Naval Academy, Magothy River, Dobbins Island, Severn River, South River, Pinehurst, Gibson Island, Sillery Bay, Bodkin Point, Severna Park, Arnold, Lake Shore, Parole, Edgewater, Cape St. Claire, Riva, Crownsville and Highland Beach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
